Comment: My favorite opening; the Sicilian Defence. I am rather disappointed that the next move does not comply with any variation of this opening.
My favorite opening; the Sicilian Defence. I am rather disappointed that the next move does not comply with any variation of this opening.
I am not sure what I was thinking with this move. Maybe I was trying to prevent 2...c4, which Black would never do. This is a critical mistake in an opening in my opinion.
Black was expecting 3.d4, a very sorrowful mistake. Better safe than sorry because as White, I would never think of playing that move.
Black observed this move for a while, and he probably realized that I put a third attacker for d5. Black, apparently, had a mind of his own.
This game is really out of control. Both me and my opponent were trying to take over the middle d squares.
Black looks like he is lagging in the opening a bit.
Black looks like he is lagging in the opening a bit.
I am not sure whether I, if I wanted a piece on d5, should have done 5.Nd5, or this move. Maybe I should have forgotten about the d5 square and instead play 5.d3.
Breakthrough for Black, but not accurate enough.
Black left his pawn in boiling soup, and the burner was not turned off! I shocked Black with this move.
Blind Black decides to ignore my Bishop and attack my knight. Big mistake.
Black looked at this sensational move that I performed. It won his rook AND won the game.
UCM (unidentied crushing move) coming after this.
UCM (unidentied crushing move) coming after this.
Black is not yet close to pulverizing my highly guarded center.
Even though I missed 9.Nd7, I looked at the opportunity to weaken Black.
That's basically why I played 9.g3!?.
Now my Queen leaps into action, and I don't have much time to waste.
What was the purpose of this move.
Here it is finally, my UCM!
You can't bomb a central attack unless you really want to see what will happen to your position.
12...Ke7 was better play for Black.
12...Ke7 was better play for Black.
